response:
Marissa has already walked 6 miles in 2 h.  
She wants an overall average of 4 mph, so the total time for 12 mi must be  

\[
\frac{12\ \text{mi}}{4\ \text{mph}} = 3\ \text{h}.
\]

With 2 h already used, she has only 1 h left to cover the remaining 6 mi, so she needs  

\[
\frac{6\ \text{mi}}{1\ \text{h}} = 6\ \text{mph}.
\]

#### 6
